RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 1 1M Dirt CR: 73. Maiden Special Weight Purse 75000. FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PANDAGATE settled off the pace, angled in near the five-eighths pole, moved closer with a half-mile to run, was asked while two then three wide on the turn, chased outside late on that bend, gained to take the lead in upper stretch, shook clear coming to the furlong marker and drew away while kept to the task. MAMA'S MIDDIE settled off the pace, was urged along while saving ground on the turn, remained on his inside lead in the stretch and safely secured the place. IN A MINUTE bobbled at the start, moved out leaving the chute then tracked the pace on the outside, was given his cue in the two path on the turn, made a bid at the five-sixteenths, led briefly into the stretch then lost the advantage to the winner, dropped back into the final furlong and weakened. INONIT settled off the pace, was urged along in the two path on the turn and came up empty. KHADULLAH veered out at the start but came out in front, went clear early then was taken in hand, stayed well out in the track leaving the chute, dropped in near the three-quarter pole, vied inside on the turn, was asked under heavy threat inside the five-sixteenths, lost the advantage into the stretch and tired. WISECRACKER was reserved off the pace, came under strong encouragement in the three path on the turn and failed to respond. ARCO AUGUSTA settled off the pace, dropped back under urging midway down the backstretch then fell to the rear of the field, went three wide on the turn and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Mama's Middie
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, inside turn, left lead stretch, no match, clear for 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Inonit
ENTRY.OWNER: The Estate of Richard J Lugovich

ENTRY.NAME: Wisecracker
ENTRY.OWNER: Broman Sr Chester and Broman Mary

ENTRY.NAME: Arco Augusta
ENTRY.OWNER: C T R Stables LLC (Ferreira) and Amarosa Anthony
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, urged 5/8, dropped to rear, 3wide turn, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Pandagate
ENTRY.OWNER: Adelphi Racing Club Madaket Stables LLC Corms Racing Stable and On The Rise Agai

ENTRY.NAME: Khadullah
ENTRY.OWNER: Rodriguez, Rudy R. and Imperio, Michael
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered out brk,clear early,in hand,rail turn,headed3/16,gave way

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 2 6F Outer turf CR: 78. Maiden Special Weight Purse 90000. OUTER TURF (UP TO $15,660 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (Rail at 12 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: REAGAN'S FLAME was hustled from the start, disputed the pace on the inside of a foe, vied along the rail on the turn, shook clear under a drive into the final furlong, responded well into the final sixteenth and just held under strong urging. LAMORNA brushed with a rival at the start then was carried in and taken up with a grab of the left-rein, settled at the rear, went two then three wide while unasked on the turn, was roused eight wide into upper stretch, rallied outside into the final furlong and finished fast but just missed while able to get the place. TWISTED ROMANCE brushed with a foe at the start then came inward, settled off the pace, saved ground on the turn, chased the leader under a drive into the final furlong, moved out while gaining coming to the sixteenth-pole then drifted out before being straightened by the rider and finished with good courage for the show. TROUBLED LUCK chased the pace under strong urging, saved ground on the turn, shifted three wide into the stretch, pursued the leader in the drive, remained on her inside lead until just outside the sixteenth-pole then swapped to the proper lead and lacked the needed kick. SALE LEASEBACK (IRE) settled off the pace then dropped towards the rear, moved from the rail to the three path on the turn, swung seven wide into upper stretch and improved position. SAVE US MELANIA contested the pace on the outside of the winner, vied in the two path on the turn, was asked near the quarter-pole then battled under a drive in upper stretch, dropped back into the final furlong and weakened. ECHO LAKE settled under some urging, moved in late on the backstretch, saved ground on the turn and lacked the needed response. CLASSIC CARA settled under some urging, raced inside to the two path on the turn, moved out some under a drive in upper stretch, angled out inside the furlong marker and failed to threaten. DOROTHY'S DREAMS was hustled from the gate then urged along towards the front, went around the turn in the two path, spun four wide into upper stretch and came up empty. JENAS MERCY was coaxed along off the pace, came under stronger encouragement while two then three wide on the turn and was no factor. MADAM LEOTA was reluctant to load, veered out at the start then was taken up with the left-rein while off heels, settled on the outside, moved from three to five wide on the turn and failed to respond. LOVE RESTRAINED was urged along on the outside, went three wide on the turn, floated six wide into the stretch and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Lamorna
ENTRY.OWNER: Arnmore Thoroughbreds LLC and West Paces Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: brshd brk,carried in,tkn up,at rear,2-3p,roused 8w3/16,closd fast

ENTRY.NAME: Twisted Romance
ENTRY.OWNER: Siena Farm LLC and WinStar Farm LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: brshd brk,came in,settled,ins turn,chsd,drift out 1/16,gd courage

ENTRY.NAME: Echo Lake
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled some urging,mvd in 7/16,inside turn,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Classic Cara
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled some urging,ins-2path turn,angled out ins 1/8,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Reagan's Flame
ENTRY.OWNER: Schwartz Martin S and Ingordo David
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,pace inside foe,rail turn,shook clear 1/8,all out,held

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Jason Hall, Herschel Martindale & Stephen Mott

ENTRY.NAME: Save Us Melania
ENTRY.OWNER: Two Eight Racing Averill Racing LLC and Twin Sports Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: outside pace, 2path turn, asked 1/4, dropped back 1/8, wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Madam Leota
ENTRY.COMMENT: hard to load,veer out brk,tkn up,3-5w turn,no response

ENTRY.NAME: Love Restrained
ENTRY.OWNER: Rocco Steven and Adelphi Racing Club
ENTRY.COMMENT: urged along outside,3w turn,6w into lane,faltered

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 3 1M Turf CR: 89. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 85000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $45,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $45,000 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% After care Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile on the Main Track.) (Rail at 9 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COLLABORATION was restless in the gate but came out in good order, showed in front early then was taken in hand and conceded the lead to a hustled foe, tracked outside in the two path, was asked outside the quarter-pole, gained to make an outside bid in upper stretch, took a short lead near the furlong marker, battled with two foes into the final sixteenth, fought with the runner-up to the finish and prevailed under strong urging. GOLDEN ROCKET went two to three wide on the first turn, settled off the pace, was asked three wide on the far turn, came four wide into the stretch, made a bid outside the eighth-pole, fought with two foes into the final sixteenth, battled with the winner to the finish and missed while able to get the place. MASTEROF THE TUNES broke out and brushed with a foe then was hustled to the lead, showed the way with a clear advantage on the inside, was asked near the quarter-pole then came under a drive in upper stretch, lost the advantage near the furlong marker, fought into the final sixteenth and was outfinished while able to get the show. WATERVILLE broke out at the start, was taken in hand on the outside early, traveled three wide on the first turn, settled near the back, was roused three wide on the final turn, came five wide into the stretch, reached a reasonable striking position into the final furlong but lacked the needed kick. STELLA MARS needed a little extra left-rein guidance into and early on the first turn, settled on the inside, was asked on the far turn, moved to the two path outside the five-sixteenths and lacked the needed response. SWEETEST PRINCESS saved ground on the first turn, settled off the pace, was asked in the two path on the far turn, came three wide into the stretch and failed to rally. ORANGE FREEZE dropped from the two path to the rail on the first turn, settled near the back, was urged along the rail on the far turn and failed to threaten.

ENTRY.NAME: Waterville
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,in hand,3w1st,settled,3w2nd trn,5w1/4,gain,no late kick

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 88. Claiming Purse 28000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR THREE YEAR OLDS. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $14,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Cl aim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JOKING WAY was hustled from the gate then coaxed along off the pace, moved out late on the backstretch, was roused three then four wide on the turn, came six wide into upper stretch, rallied outside into the final furlong, closed well to get the lead nearing the sixteenth-pole and prevailed under strong handling. TOMMY GUN was hustled from the gate then moved in early, contested the pace on the outside, vied in the two to three path on the turn, spun four wide into upper stretch then shook clear, led under a drive into the final furlong, was collared by the winner coming to the sixteenth-pole and missed while able to get the place. BIG SAVE settled off the pace, was roused while saving ground on the turn, chased inside in the stretch and finished with good courage for the show. AMANI'S EAGLE settled in third position, was asked in the two path on the turn, came five wide into upper stretch, moved in while gaining quickly on the leader into the final furlong, chased to the finish and just missed the show. ON THE COME UP disputed the pace on the inside of a rival, vied along the rail on the turn, spun off the inside into the stretch and tired. MOVING PICTURES had a shoe repaired in the paddock, settled near the back, went two to three wide on the turn and failed to threaten. TRUEBELIEVE was urged along on the outside, went four wide on the turn and was no factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Moving Pictures
ENTRY.OWNER: Werner J Stable and Rodriguez Rudy R
ENTRY.COMMENT: shoe repair paddock, settled near back, 2-3path turn, no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Truebelieve
ENTRY.OWNER: Three Player's Stable and Barrera III Oscar S
ENTRY.COMMENT: urged along outside, 4wide turn, no factor

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 5 1 1/8M Outer turf CR: 95. Starter Allowance Purse 65000. OUTER TURF (UP TO $11,310 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $50,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN OR CLAIMING. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. (Rail at 12 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HARRY HOOD went three wide on the first turn, settled off the pace, was asked three wide on the far turn, rallied four wide in to the stretch, made a bid at the three-sixteenths then took the lead, disposed of FRONT MAN into the final sixteenth and held under strong urging. LORD FLINTSHIRE was well placed just off the pace on the inside, came off the rail into the stretch, was coaxed behind foes into the final furlong then altered out, gained in the final sixteenth and finished well for the place. FRONT MAN went three wide on the first turn, tracked the pace, traveled around the far turn in the two path, was asked near the quarter-pole, made a three wide bid into upper stretch, battled under a drive to the sixteenth-pole and was outfinished while just able to get the show. SONIC SPEED settled on the inside, saved ground behind foes on the far turn, was asked into the stretch, lacked from behind horses from inside the three-sixteenths into the final furlong then moved out while roused and finished with good courage to just miss the show. MIRACLE MIKE was hustled from the gate, dropped from the two path to the rail on the first turn, settled off the pace, moved out late on the backstretch, shifted from two to four wide on the final turn, came six wide into the stretch and improved position. THETHRILLOFVICTORY broke a step slow, pulled under restraint early, went three to four wide on the turns, came five wide into the stretch and lacked the needed kick. JARREAU was hustled from the gate then moved in, went two to three wide on the turns and failed to rally. ST. JOE LOUIS (GB) went to the front, rounded the first turn in the two path, showed the way down the backstretch, vied inside on the far turn, was asked near the quarter-pole, lost the lead in upper stretch and gave way. BLAME D RULE MAKER was off slow and spotted the front a few lengths, went three then two wide on the first turn, settled towards the rear, was roused three to four wide on the far turn and failed to threaten. ZAPRUDER raced near the back while inside to the two path, came four wide into the stretch and was no factor. BLU GROTTO dropped well behind, raced inside to the two path on the turns and was eased then walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: Blu Grotto
ENTRY.OWNER: Imperio Michael Rodriguez Rudy R and Gurdon Andrew
ENTRY.COMMENT: well behind ,inside-2path turns, eased, walked off

ENTRY.NAME: Miracle Mike
ENTRY.OWNER: Franklin Ave Equine LLC and International Equine

ENTRY.NAME: Sonic Speed
ENTRY.OWNER: Zilla Racing Stables Gray Riders Stable PlayingTheField Racing and Acqua Nova St

ENTRY.NAME: Thethrillofvictory
ENTRY.OWNER: Paradise Farms Corp and Staudacher David

ENTRY.NAME: Front Man
ENTRY.OWNER: Krakow Racing LLC and America's Pastime Stables

ENTRY.NAME: St. Joe Louis (GB)
ENTRY.OWNER: Little Blue Bird Stables LLC and Upback Racing LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 6 1 1/16M Turf CR: 76. Maiden Special Weight Purse 90000. (UP TO $15,660 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile on the Main Track.) (Rail at 9 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WALLEY WORLD went two to three wide on the first turn, tracked the pace on the outside, ranged up in the three path on the far turn, made a bid at the five-sixteenths, took the lead while asked at the top of the stretch, responded well under pressure into the final furlong then drew clear under strong handling. TOM COLLINS saved ground on the first turn, settled off the pace, went around the far turn in the two path, was roused four wide into the stretch, pursued the winner in the drive and narrowly earned the place. MIDNIGHT COUNCIL jostled with a rival leaving the chute, tucked into the two path on the first turn, settled off the pace, was urged three then four wide on the far turn, chased just behind the winner into the final furlong and proved no match then lost the place. PRARIEDALE was off slow and spotted the front a few lengths, saved ground on the first turn, settled at the rear, rounded the far turn in the two path, came out at the quarter-pole then angled further out in the stretch and improved position. INHERENT PROMISE jostled with a rival leaving the chute then became extremely rank, fought vigorously against the rating tactics of the rider, went three to four wide on the turns, came five wide into the stretch and also improved position. FRED GEORGE (IRE) moved in while going to the front, showed the way while inside to the two path, lost the lead to the winner at the quarter-pole and gave way. MESSAGE OF HOPE (IRE) was off slow and spotted the front a few lengths, raced inside to the two path on the turns and failed to impact. DON VINO VICI jostled with rivals leaving the chute, went around the first turn in the two path, was reserved off the pace, saved ground on the far turn and lacked the needed response. GOLDEN PLATE tossed his head while very rank on the opening straightaway, continued keen while inside to the two path on the first turn, was reserved off the pace, went four wide on the far turn, came five wide into the stretch, drifted in some near the sixteenth-pole and failed to rally. GAME MISCONDUCT was taken in hand early, saved ground while well placed just off the pace, was asked for his best in upper stretch and came up empty. ANCHISES went two to three wide on the turns and failed to threaten. ADMIRAL NIMITZ (GB) went around the first turn in the two path, settled near the back, saved ground on the far turn and showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Tom Collins
ENTRY.OWNER: Janney, III, Stuart S. and Phipps Stable

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Plate
ENTRY.OWNER: Fern Circle Stables and Gainesway Stable (Antony Beck)

ENTRY.NAME: Don Vino Vici
ENTRY.OWNER: Sal-Lou J G Stable Cotrone Robert Carmine Cirrincione Stables and Como Salvatore

ENTRY.NAME: Game Misconduct
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand,well placed inside,saved ground,came up empty

ENTRY.NAME: Prariedale
ENTRY.OWNER: Harrell Ventures LLC and Seaside Racing

ENTRY.NAME: Midnight Council
ENTRY.OWNER: Team Hanley and Thirty Year Farm

ENTRY.NAME: Walley World
ENTRY.OWNER: LaPenta Robert V e Five Racing Thoroughbreds and Madaket Stables LLC

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Fred W. Hertrich lll & Robert L.Tribbett

ENTRY.NAME: Fred George (IRE)
ENTRY.OWNER: Reeves Thoroughbred Racing and Dalinka Brandon M

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 78. Maiden Claiming Purse 47000. (UP TO $8,178 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: VODKA MARDINI was hustled from the start, showed the way down the backstretch, controlled the action while inside on the turn, extended the advantage late on that bend, remained well clear into the final furlong, shortened stride under the crop into the final sixteenth and held under steady urging. SCREAMING UNCLE bumped with a rival at the start, dropped off the pace then was urged along on the outside, went three wide on the turn, turned into upper stretch under a drive, gained on the tired leader in the final furlong and finished willingly for the place. AULA was hustled from the gate then urged along off the pace, moved from the two path to the four path on the turn and lacked the needed response while best of the rest. GROWTH MINDSET was coaxed along off the pace, saved ground under stronger encouragement on the turn and failed to respond. WHENLOVETAKESOVER bumped with a foe at the start then was hustled, showed speed then tracked the pace on the outside, chased in the two path on the turn and tired. NO SURRENDER was reluctant to load then broke inward, raced inside under urging, dropped back outside the half-mile pole, moved from the rail to the three path on the turn and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: No Surrender
ENTRY.COMMENT: hard to load,broke in,urged along,drop back1/2,ins-3p,faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Growth Mindset
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed along,urged rail turn,failed to respond

ENTRY.NAME: Screaming Uncle
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,drop back,urged along,3w turn,willingly for place

TRACK.NAME: Foreign track with Code of NEW

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 8 1 1/4M Dirt CR: 104. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 102000. (UP TO $17,748 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $62,500. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Ol der, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $62,500 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim OtherwiseC laim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CONSTITUTIONLAWYER was taken in hand while established position early, saved ground while rated just off the pace, came through a rail opening inside the three-eighths pole to make a bid then took the lead coming to the five-sixteenths, responded well when put to the crop in the stretch and held under strong urging. GOOD SKATE bobbled at the start then was hustled to the front, raced inside to the two path on the first turn, showed the way with a clear advantage while off the rail down the backstretch, vied in the two path on the far turn, left the rail open and lost the lead to the winner coming to the five-sixteenths pole, kept on well in pursuit of that foe in the stretch but missed while clear for second. COSTA TERRA was hustled from the gate then wrested back off the pace nearing the first turn, raced in the three path on that bend, settled on the outside, moved closer around the nine-sixteenths, chased four wide for most of the far turn then dropped to the three path, lugged in in the stretch and lacked the needed kick while clear for the show. IRON WORKS was hustled from the gate, went two to three wide on the first turn, stalked the pace on the outside, was coaxed along passing the half-mile pole, chased three wide for most of the far turn then dropped to the two path and tired. MYSTIC NIGHT rounded the first turn in the two path, settled on the outside, was urged along late on the backstretch, traveled three wide on the far turn and failed to respond. TONAL IMPACT saved ground on the first turn, settled off the rail on the backstretch, was urged passing the half-mile pole, went two then three wide on the far turn, drifted out in upper stretch and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Tonal Impact
ENTRY.OWNER: Two B and One C Stable

ENTRY.NAME: Constitutionlawyer
ENTRY.OWNER: West Paces Racing LLC Brown Road Racing Adelphi Racing Club Hume Shelly and Hume

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Silver Springs Stud, LLC & Sandra Sexton

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 9 6F Outer turf CR: 88. Maiden Special Weight Purse 90000. OUTER TURF (UP TO $15,660 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (Rail at 12 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CIGARETTE BOAT showed speed on the inside of a rival then dropped off the pace near the nine-sixteenths, saved ground on the turn, was asked in the two path at the quarter-pole, moved out in pursuit of the leader outside the furlong marker, made a bid inside that marker, took the lead into the final sixteenth then moved clear under good handling. FOREIGN INFLUENCE was reserved off the pace, raced off heels under tight restraint late on the backstretch, saved ground on the turn, chased in upper stretch, lacked room along the rail inside the furlong marker and waited, bravely squeezed through inside of the pacesetter in the final sixteenth and willingly earned the place. ALEXIS ZORBA (GB) showed speed on the outside then moved clear at the nine-sixteenths, was challenged while in the two path on the turn, led under a drive until near the sixteenth-pole then was overtaken by the winner and lost the place. HIGHLAND LORD settled off the pace, was taken under snug restraint when the winner dropped back near the nine-sixteenths, became rank while behind horses late on the backstretch, was let out in the two path on the turn, spun three wide into the stretch and lacked the needed response. RINGSIDE settled on the outside, was asked four wide on the turn and also lacked the needed response. VENGE settled towards the rear, traveled around the turn in the two path and failed to threaten. IRON MAN JIMMY broke out at the start, settled on the outside, was roused three wide on the turn, came five wide into the stretch and failed to rally. BORLETTI (IRE) was forwardly placed down the backstretch, came under urging in the three path on the turn, made a bid at the five-sixteenths, dropped back into the final furlong and weakened. TAP YOUR HEART broke a step slow, settled at the back, went three wide on the turn and failed to respond.

ENTRY.NAME: Ringside
ENTRY.OWNER: Goldfarb Sanford J Carney Christopher L and Kahn Alan

ENTRY.NAME: Borletti (IRE)
ENTRY.OWNER: Sterling Road Stables and Race Point Stables LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Cigarette Boat
ENTRY.OWNER: Pura Vida Investments LLC Hutson Cindy M and Setzer Brett
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed ins foe,drop back4-1/2,ins turn,2p1/4,mvd out,bid ins1/8,up

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Hurstland Farm, Inc. & James Greene Jr.

ENTRY.NAME: Tap Your Heart
ENTRY.OWNER: Chapman, James K. and Tsujimoto, Stuart
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow,settled at back,3wide turn,no response

ENTRY.NAME: Iron Man Jimmy
ENTRY.OWNER: Ironhorse Racing Stable LLC and Five C's Stable
